history.content: I don't know if this helps, but last Spring, Hug expanded the class to include almost everyone who persisted on the waitlist, resulting in a final class size of 1391. I can't guarantee this will be the case this semester too, but with the current number of open seats > waitlist size, I think you have a pretty good shot at getting in if you smartly pick your discussion/lab times.

children.subject: That's awesome to hear! Thanks, hopefully they do it this year as well.

history.content:
Hi, asked this in the 61A Piazza as well, was directed to here. 

I'm a second year trying to enroll in 61B today, but I've already declared a non-CS major, so I believe that I would just be placed on the waitlist (based on https://eecs.berkeley.edu/resources/undergrads/cs/degree-reqs/enrollment-policy).

 

With the waitlist at around 300 and about 300 remaining but currently reserved seats, could anyone give an estimate on my chances of getting into the class? I've generally been under the impression that lower div CS classes are usually fairly easy to get into, but my other backup classes are likely going to fill up soon, so advice here would be much appreciated! :)
history.subject: CS61B Enrollment?
